intro: Argythamnia serrata var. magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalenae thornapple, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, branched stems covered in fine, white hairs, and its leaves are narrow, serrated, and often slightly hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer, followed by spherical, spiny fruits. It is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
